label: 解由状
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A document given by the incoming official to the outgoing official, showing that everything was in order and satisfactory when the former took over the official post of the latter. Unless the outgoing official received such a document he was ineligible for other offices. These documents were generally inspected by the Investigators of the Records of Outgoing Officials (Kageyushi) to see whether or not they were in order.
